Description: A terrracotta upper-mould fragment for a female saint or a beneficent demon, with a large hairstyle, possibly a wreath or a nimbus, as registration no. 1907,0112.20 and probably taken from the same archetype. Broken across at breast level (the impression illustrated cuts off above the breasts, even though parts of them are present in the mould). Two straps of clay survive at the rear. Micaceous pale-red Aswan kaolinite clay, the outside coated with a matt red-brown slip.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired at Elephantine. Late Roman, sixth to seventh century AD. Bibliog: Bailey 1986: pl. lxxd.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3400)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
